main event: A bright stationary light was observed in the southwest sky from Longmont, Colorado, on 26 October 1966 for three hours.
interesting points: The light remained uniform in brightness except for minor fluctuations in intensity.,The object was described as a bright white light, about 1/4 the size of a full moon.,It was debated whether the object was a star or planet based on its characteristics.,Witnesses reported a pulsating red light emitted from the object.,The light was considered a possible astronomical optical phenomenon.
